title: Unusual Noises
description: Diagnose unusual noises on the Kymco Like 125i scooter from CVT, engine, and exhaust areas.

nodes.text: Where does the noise come from on your Like 125i?

options.text: Slapping or flapping that changes with speed
Rattling or clicking at idle/low speed

nodes.instructions: Remove the CVT cover. Inspect the belt for cracks, fraying, missing chunks, or glazing. A damaged belt slaps against the pulleys. Measure width — replace if significantly narrower than the new specification (approximately 18mm). A belt about to fail makes a slapping sound.

Remove the variator face plate to access the 6 roller weights. Check each for flat spots — the most common noise source. Flat-spotted rollers tumble unevenly in the variator ramps, creating a clicking or rattling noise at idle and low speed.

The centrifugal clutch can squeal from glazed shoes or make noise from worn springs. Remove and inspect the clutch shoes for glazing, and the clutch bell for grooves. Also check the driven pulley torque driver pins and contra spring for wear — these can rattle when worn.

nodes.text: Check for debris in CVT case
nodes.instructions: Grinding from the CVT area can be debris (broken roller fragments, gravel) inside the case, or a loose/misaligned CVT cover. Check all cover bolts and inspect inside for foreign material.

nodes.warning: Check with engine cold at TDC compression stroke.
nodes.instructions: Ticking from the head that increases with RPM is valve train noise. Check clearances with feeler gauges. Typical specs: intake 0.10mm, exhaust 0.15mm. Loose valves tick but are less harmful than tight valves. Also check the cam chain tension — a rattling from the cylinder can indicate a loose cam chain.

options.text: Valves OK but cam chain rattles

nodes.warning: Bottom-end knocking indicates serious wear. Professional diagnosis recommended.
nodes.instructions: Use a mechanics stethoscope or long screwdriver (blade on engine, handle to ear) at the crankcase. Deep knocking under load = worn rod bearing. Rattle at idle that fades at higher RPM = piston slap. Check oil level first — low oil worsens bottom-end noises.

options.text: Idle rattle that fades when warm

nodes.warning: Exhaust is extremely hot. Inspect when cold only.
nodes.instructions: Check: (1) Exhaust header gasket — soot marks indicate a leak causing ticking, (2) Mounting bolts and brackets for tightness, (3) Heat shields for rattling, (4) Internal muffler baffles for loose rattling.

nodes.details: A damaged belt risks breaking. Use the correct size. Replace every 8,000-12,000 km. Inspect rollers and clutch at the same time.

nodes.action: Replace all 6 rollers as a set.
nodes.details: Never mix old and new. Use stock weight (typically 12-13g, 15x12mm). Also inspect variator ramp plate. Apply molybdenum grease to the variator boss.

nodes.action: Replace glazed or worn clutch shoes.
nodes.details: Glazed shoes cause squealing. Replace shoes and springs. Sand the clutch bell interior lightly to remove glaze.
Deep grooves in the bell cause noise and uneven engagement. Replace bell and shoes together.

nodes.action: Disassemble and service the driven pulley assembly.
nodes.details: Clean all parts, inspect torque driver pins and contra spring. Apply fresh molybdenum grease. Replace any worn components.

nodes.action: Remove debris and secure the CVT cover.
nodes.details: Identify the source of debris and address the root cause. Tighten all cover bolts. Ensure gasket is properly seated.

nodes.warning: Engine must be cold. Work at TDC compression stroke.
nodes.details: Intake 0.10mm, exhaust 0.15mm (verify with manual). Check every 8,000-12,000 km.

nodes.warning: A severely worn cam chain can skip and cause engine damage.
nodes.action: Replace the cam chain tensioner or chain.
nodes.details: If the tensioner is fully extended, the chain has stretched and needs replacement. This requires top-end disassembly.

nodes.warning: Stop riding. Continued operation risks catastrophic failure.
nodes.details: A deep knock indicates worn rod or crank bearings. Full teardown required. Consider replacement engine vs. rebuild cost.

nodes.warning: Piston slap indicates cylinder wear. Plan for top-end work.
nodes.action: Monitor the condition and check oil more frequently.
nodes.details: Light rattle at cold idle that fades warm indicates increased piston-to-cylinder clearance. Not immediately dangerous but will worsen. Plan for eventual top-end rebuild.

nodes.warning: Exhaust bolts may be seized. Use penetrating oil.
nodes.details: Remove header bolts, replace gasket, clean mating surfaces. Tighten evenly to spec.

nodes.action: Tighten all loose exhaust bolts and heat shields.
nodes.details: Apply anti-seize to bolts. Replace any missing fasteners.

nodes.action: Replace the muffler if internal baffles are loose.
nodes.details: Internal rattle from broken baffles cannot be repaired. Replace with OEM or quality aftermarket muffler.
